item.title: Quantum computers and quantum programming: What are they?
item.description: Classical Computers vs Quantum Computers Quantum computers, which have been gaining increased attention in recent years, differ from the computers we use in our daily lives. What is the fundamental difference? The most significant and fundamental difference lies in the bit. Let’s refer to the computers we use daily as classical computers. In classical computers, processing is done by assigning each bit a value of either 0 or 1. When discussing quantum computers, the bits used in classical computers are often called classical bits.
